gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class TabbedViewControl

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ViewControl
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.TabbedViewControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class TabbedViewControl
extends ViewControl

This is a 'container' ViewControl that contains a number of ViewControls in it. Each ViewControl is placed in its own tab on a tabbed pane on this ViewControl. The setControlValue(Object) method can be used to set the control value for any ViewControl located on this tabbed pane. Next, the getControlValue() method is used to get the control value of the ViewControl on the currently selected tab. However, the getControlValue(int) method can be used to get the control value of a ViewControl on any tab.

Notice that this ViewControl can only add other ViewControl objects to the tabbed pane. It cannot add IViewControl objects to the tabbed pane. This is because an object must be a Component to be added to the tabbed pane. A ViewControl is an object that implements IViewControl and is a Component. Thus, it can be used as an IViewControl and can be added to the tabbed pane.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

VIEW_CONTROL_STATE_AT

public static final java.lang.String VIEW_CONTROL_STATE_AT
"VIEW_CONTROL_STATE_AT_" - This static constant string is the key for referencing the state information for the ViewControl on a given tab. The value that this key references is an ObjectState.

To use this key to get the ObjectState of the ViewControl that is located on a particluar tab, concatenate the index of the tab to the end of this key. The following code gives an example:


int i = 2;
String key = VIEW_CONTROL_STATE_AT+i;

//now 'key' can be used to reference the ObjectState of the
//the ViewControl that is located on the tab with index 2
//(Note: indexing starts at 0. Thus, the first tab has an
// index of 0)

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

TabbedViewControl

public TabbedViewControl(java.lang.String con_title,
                         java.util.Vector viewControlVec)
Constructs this ViewControl such that it contains a tabbed pane containing each of the ViewControls given in the Vector viewControlVec where each ViewControl is placed on its own tab.

Notice: The String returned from the getTitle() method invoked on the ViewControl of a particular tab is used as the title of that tab.

Parameters:
con_title - The title of this ViewControl
viewControlVec - Contains the ViewControls to be placed on the tab pane. If this parameter is null nothing will be placed on the tabbed pane. Also, only the elements in the Vector that are ViewControls will be placed on the tabbed pane.

TabbedViewControl

public TabbedViewControl(java.util.Vector viewControlVec)
Constructs this ViewControl exactly the same as the constructor TabbedViewControl(String, Vector) would. However, it sets this ViewControl's title to be the empty String.

Parameters:
viewControlVec - Contains the ViewControls to be placed on the tab pane. If this parameter is null nothing will be placed on the tabbed pane. Also, only the elements in the Vector that are ViewControls will be placed on the tabbed pane.
See Also:
TabbedViewControl(String, Vector)
Method Detail

setControlValue

public void setControlValue(java.lang.Object value)
Used to set the value of one of the ViewControls contained on the tabbed pane. Also, the tab containing this ViewControl is made the currently selected tab.

Specified by:
setControlValue in interface IViewControl
Specified by:
setControlValue in class ViewControl
Parameters:
value - This object must be a TabbedViewControl.TabValuePair object.
  1. The getIndex() method is invoked on this object to find the index of the tab containing the ViewControl to use.
  2. The setControlValue(Object) method is invoked on this ViewControl object.
  3. The value passed to the setControlValue(Object) method is the value returned from the getValue() method that is invoked on the TabbedViewControl.TabValuePair argument passed to this method.
Note: If the index found from the getIndex() method is invalid or if value is null or isn't an object of type TabbedViewControl.TabValuePair nothing is done.

getControlValue

public java.lang.Object getControlValue()
Used to get the control value of the ViewControl on the currently selected tab.

Specified by:
getControlValue in interface IViewControl
Specified by:
getControlValue in class ViewControl
Returns:
The value returned from the getControlValue() invoked on the ViewControl located on the currently selected tab. Note: If none of the tab are currently selected or if there isn't a ViewControl on the selected tab, null is returned.
See Also:
getControlValue(int)

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
Used to get an ObjectState object that encapsulates the ObjecStates of all of the ViewControls located this the tabbed pane. See the VIEW_CONTROL_STATE_AT documentation to learn how to reference each of these ObjectStates.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IViewControl
Overrides:
getObjectState in class ViewControl
Parameters:
isDefault -
  • If true the default configuration for each ViewControl is used.
  • If false the current configuration of each ViewControl is used.
Returns:
An Object state holding the current configuration of all of the ViewControls on this tabbed pane.

setObjectState

public void setObjectState(ObjectState state)
Used to set the ObjectState of each of the ViewControls located on this tabbed pane. See the VIEW_CONTROL_STATE_AT documentation to learn how to determine the key that references each ObjectState.

Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IViewControl
Overrides:
setObjectState in class ViewControl
Parameters:
state - An ObjectState that holds the ObjecState of each of the ViewControls on this tabbed pane.

getViewControlAt

public ViewControl getViewControlAt(int index)
Used to get the ViewControl on the tab with the given index.

Parameters:
index - The index of the tab to reference. Note: Indexing starts at 0. Thus, the first tab has index 0.
Returns:
The ViewControl on the tab with the given index. Note: If index is invalid or if there isn't a ViewControl on the tab null is returned.

getIndexForViewControl

public int getIndexForViewControl(ViewControl control)
Used to get the index of the tab that the given ViewControl is located on.

Parameters:
control - The ViewControl whose tab's index is to be located.
Returns:
The index of the tab that contains the ViewControl control. Note: If control is null or if no tabs contain control -1 is returned.

getViewControls

public java.util.Vector getViewControls()
Used to get all of the ViewControls located on the tabbed pane. The ViewControls are placed in the Vector in the same order that they are located on the tabbed pane.

Returns:
A Vector of all of the ViewControls on the tabbed pane.

getControlValue

public java.lang.Object getControlValue(int index)
Used to get the control value of the ViewControl on the given tab.

Parameters:
index - The index of the tab to use. Note: Indexing starts at 0. Therefore, the first tab on the tabbed pane has index 0.
Returns:
The value returned from the getControlValue() invoked on the ViewControl located on the specified tab. Note: If index is invalid or if there isn't a ViewControl on the tab, null is returned.

getNumTabs

public int getNumTabs()
Used to determine the number of tabs located on the tabbed pane.

Returns:
The number of tabs on the tabbed pane.

setSelectedTab

public void setSelectedTab(int index)
Makes the tab with the given index the selected tab. Note: If the index given is invalid, nothing is done.

Parameters:
index - The index of the tab which will become the selected tab.

setSelectedTab

public void setSelectedTab(ViewControl control)
Makes the tab with the given ViewControl the selected tab. Note: If control is null or if no tabs contain control, nothing is done.

Parameters:
control - The ViewControl which identifies the tab to become the selected tab.

getSelectedTab

public int getSelectedTab()
Used to determine which tab is selected.

Returns:
The index of the selected tab or -1 if no tabs are selected.

getSelectedViewControl

public ViewControl getSelectedViewControl()
Used to get the ViewControl located on the selected tab.

Returns:
The ViewControl on the selected tab or null if no tabs are selected.
